intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium eminens, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The plant features basal and alternate leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the Asteraceae family. Hieracium eminens is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
